topics.body:
I'm about to go to bed cause I've been up for two and a half days, but I had a interesting thought; probably the biggest shit storm computer wise in the next five years is prebaked programs.  I'm not necessarily sure of the correct terminology for this cause I'm very tired, but what I mean by this is you know how derpibooru is a extremely modified booru with while it being a booru has cool things like the how we're using a extremely modified forums?  Basically like that but on the macro scale.  What I mean by this is instead of youtube clone #2342432, you'll have youbooru where almost all the code is based off another site where the source code is open source or such.

It's going to piss of a lot of programmers in the long run because the current model is extremely closed source where you get a cap in your ass if you reveal the source code.  What's probably going to wind up happening in the long run is a lot more websites with prebaked programming behind it.  So things like facebook right now let's face it you don't need nearly as much bandwidth as a video hosting site and there's already thousands of clone sites; now imagine how there's so many clone social media sites of facebook and apply it to other sites.

What's probably going to wind up happening to google, facebook, youtube and so forth is that they're going to start fading out of existence the more easy it is to have websites that big for less money.

What I mean by this is ten years ago social media sites where a big deal that everyone thought was some extravagant thing and now they're no big deal; what happened to myspace is probably going to happen to youtube eventually and they're going to fade out of existence.


Tl:dr; chances are the big boys on the internet will fade out of existence due to technological changes making them obsolete in a decade or so.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
